articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Saudi Aramco looks to expand largest US refinery
articles.description: Saudi Aramco IPO-ARMO.SE took the first steps toward expanding the largest U.S. refinery on Saturday, which is operated by its subsidiary Motiva Enterprises.

articles.title: China's Tariffs on Boeing Aircraft: Much Ado About Nothing?
articles.description: China plans to impose tariffs on some aircraft imports in response to U.S. tariffs on a variety of Chinese goods. But the aircraft tariffs seem deliberately designed to avoid having much impact on Boeing.

articles.title: UPDATED: Sheriff's Office seeking Dollar General robbery suspect
articles.description: SCHUYLERVILLE — The Saratoga County Sheriff’s Office is searching for a robbery suspect who allegedly took cash from a register at a Dollar General on Spring Street late Friday evening.

articles.title: California may soon allow passengers in driverless cars
articles.description: California's public utility regulator has issued  a proposal to allow driverless cars to pick up and drop off passengers.

articles.description: A decade ago, Delta and Northwest struck a deal to merge, setting off a decade of consolidation in the industry.

You know it's serious when a landlord sues over $1.

articles.title: US hiring slows in March, but job market still looks healthy
articles.description: WASHINGTON — U.S. employers added a modest 103,000 jobs in March after several months of robust gains, though the government’s overall jobs report Friday suggested the labor market remains fundamentally

articles.author: John Bowden
articles.title: FCC won't release emails on Pai's 'Harlem Shake' video
articles.description: The FCC will not turn over emails related to the filming of a 2017 PSA starring Chairman Ajit Pai in support of ending net neutrality rules, according to a statement received by the nonprofit that requested the records.

articles.title: This Sears is closing Sunday, and shoppers say Amazon is to blame

articles.title: As Facebook confronts tough questions, Europe might force real change
articles.description: Concerns over privacy and ethics have triggered an unprecedented debate in Europe around how -- and not whether -- to regulate U.S. tech giants.

articles.title: Bon-Ton officials hope to 'preserve jobs' after state announces closure of 12 Wisconsin stores
articles.description: Bon-Ton Stores Inc. officials said they are hopeful that "jobs will be preserved through a sale process" after a state agency announced the potential closure of 12 Wisconsin Boston Stores and Younkers Friday.

articles.author: Ruth Simon
articles.title: Trump Organization's Web Store Collects Sales Tax in Only Two States
articles.description: The Trump administration is pushing for online retailers to pay more in state and local taxes. One retailer that could be affected by a stricter tax policy: the online store of the Trump Organization, which collects sales tax from consumers in only two states.
